title: If Riot is going to ban all supports who roam to support instead of babysitting the adc...
body:
Then why hasn't  {{champion:432}} been removed from the game?
If being a roaming support, and maybe counterjungling to support your jg and screw theirs is poor communication, then why don't you remove bard from the game? His whole mechanic is to leave some health pots bot lane and then roam most of the game. Would they ban a smite bard support for roaming?
I doubt it, because riot designed him to be a roaming support who rarely, if at all goes to bot lane other than to check up and leave some pots.
If players use other champions like Nunu and Singed to effectively do the same thing as Bard does then how is it different? Why would they get banned without a removal announcement for Bard when he's almost as off meta a roaming support as they are, and plays to a similar set strategy and fantasy? It's Riot games, not MontethePython's games, so i respect how they want to run their company and i'll continue playing so long as i enjoy it, but atleast give us clarification of how your system works, because you claim not to punish for off-meta picks, and yet you seem to only mean you won't ban for certain off-meta picks.

"Poor communication" is not an excuse for banning someone who's communicating fine but playing an off meta pick successfully. I see a lot more Meta picks who never type all game, Hell, most players rarely type to communicate game strategy or explain themselves anyway. Why are these generic silent Viktor mids not banned for Poor communication while a pick rioters don't like who communicates in game is? Seems like the banning for playing off meta system is mostly based of the rioter's bias who handles the report. Instead of operating off blind bias please let us know what is acceptable and outline some guidelines for what off meta picks and roles you find acceptable and unacceptable, because it's obvious that previous statements saying Riot does not punish or discourage off meta roles and picks is no longer true.

Also, WookieCookie said: "I will be working with the team to clarify an escalation process that emphasizes clearer feedback and opens the door for ban reductions if we believe that someone can make changes to their play style allowing them to continue crushing the meta but not at the expense of their teammates."
Well isn't any off meta choice going to have it's own pros and cons? Either way if you play any off meta pick it will be somehow at a certain expense to your teamates, as well as a certain advantage to your teammates. Only banning certain off meta playstyles' but not others because they have different downsides seems biased and hypocritical. Why is the MF support who takes some farm and builds Frost Queen's claim not banned while the nunu smite support who roams and counterjungles is? It simply doesn't seem fair for someone to get punished for something there are no guidelines on.

Tldr: Why does Bard get a pass for leaving his adc alone all game while others get banned for it. Why are only certain roaming supports ok? Atleast give us some guidlines Riot

To expect them to change for him every game when he is never willing to change for them is hypocrisy. And _that_ is why he was punished, not for playing off-meta.

Meaning, In the majority of ranked games played, there will usually always be that _somebody_ who will either flip out if you want to go off-meta, or at the very least disagree with off-meta because _they don't think it will win_, or someone that won't say anything but then if you lose the game they'll report you and grief that way. They need to conform to whatever the current meta-game is currently being played, or risk punishment.

I just want to get this straight then;

You feel like it's fine for people to impose their personal strategies on other people, no matter how much it dislodges them from what they are comfortable in, so long as the person doing the dislodging believes that it is a viable strategy?

Because I don't.

I believe that both sides should attempt to come to an agreement if someone wants to play something that isn't common knowledge. If an agreement can't be reached, both parties should default to the standard meta since, collectively, both parties are much more likely to know the standard meta more than both parties are to know the weird off-meta strategy that was only really known by one person and never even thought of by the other.

Does this make me a meta-slave in your eyes? Sure, whatever floats your boat. But I usually say I'm fine with these types of weird plays, and I have been left alone in bot lane as ADC. But I also respect the wishes of players that don't want or wouldn't be as comfortable doing the same.

Simply because someone else isn't _comfortable_ enough with it? That's not a valid enough reason. Get in a queue with me and pick something, anything, for your role. Then let me disagree with your pick and tell you I'm not comfortable with it, because it doesn't mesh with _my concept of the best pick for your role_. Then tell me you disagree and you want to play what you want to play. Now what? Do I get to force you to conform, or do you get the freedom to decide what you get to play?

Do you see now how that kind of "logic" doesn't work ?

I would be the actual one at fault for assuming I have the right to tell you not to play this or do that; especially since _riots support site says I can't report you for going off meta or for disagreeing with your tactical decisions_". Hence my saltiness or griefing is _actually the one causing the negative environment_, not the other way around.

I will tell you from personal experience - in about 75% of games, your team will either be interested in your idea, apathetic to it, or can be talked into going along with it. Only about 25% of your games will you run into "hard" opposition that won't even consider it. 

And I will tell you right now, you _should not_ force your champion or strategy on your team in those games. There are 2 reasons for this:

1. It _will_ make for a bad game. They may be the ones getting upset, but you are able to stop that. Be nice, go along with the team, and try to win a different way. Don't add fuel to their fire.

2. You _will_ make it harder for the next person who tries your idea out. The more you antagonize people in your games, the less open they'll be to the idea in the future - whether you win or lose. If you lose in the 75% of games, no big deal, it was just a bad game - they'll still be willing to try it again  (unless it was just really, really bad). If you lose in the 25% of games while forcing your idea on your team, it _will_ turn them against the idea in the future. And even a victory will leave a sour taste in their mouth.

So, again, most games you can convince your team to go along with you, but some games you just need to back off. And as I said, this is from personal experience.

this only happens to bottom lane actually.  Heck, a top laner could come mid, crowd control the mid to death, get their mid fed and proceed to steamroll the game

the top would have a mild disadvantage, but if the gesture was returned in kind, things work

the problem is, thanks to riot enforcing the ADC/support system (even mordekaiser...yuck), most ADC actually have the misbelief that a support is necessary to them in bottom lane because they constantly risk dangerous plays while the support does the damage and crowd control the ADC needs whereas actually, the player should focus more on farming and not on engages

I do agree that an ADC doesn't need to be babysat in lane, heck I've told various supports to go and roam at one point or another in a multitude of games. The problem that comes from roaming as a support is not necessarily that the ADC will start making aggressive plays, it's that the ADC (with the roaming support) can potentially be zoned off entirely from farming. Sure they can farm under tower a bit, but even that can become a dangerous prospect should the enemy lane dive or even be pushed in long enough to take the tower. And as this goes on, the ADC will become more and more starved and fall further and further behind. 

ADC's NEED a gold income, farming is the most dependable way to achieve this. Take that away but losing lane presence and the ADC is essentially useless, sure they can roam for kills, but we all know that farm matters a lot. So the ADC is being handicapped without ever really having a say in it or even being able to do a whole lot about it. 

The risk/reward of having the support roam depends on almost too many variables to even debate...  who the solo ADC is, who the enemy bot lane is, will the roaming support get any benefit from roaming (kill, vision, counter jungle, or an objective), what the state of the game is.

Mid
Top

Sup
Jg
Fill

It's the only role that can counter jungle effectively from lvl 1. My point is simply that he can't pick "roam support" or "counter jungle" because that isn't an option. This gives Bot lane the assumption that whomever queued up as SUP will remain with him in bot lane. 

This is the main reason why he gets reported, because he doesn't stay and ensure the bot lane gets fed but instead focuses on other winning lanes and map control knowing bot will suffer. If bot lane knew ahead of time that there was a possibility that his SUP could be "counter jungle" or roaming most of the game then at least he wouldn't have an expectation for nunu to live up to.

I'm not arguing that people should be able to play however they want, it's riot's game. They aren't banned because "Riot didn't like their pick". And the other players don't go unpunished because "they were playing an acceptable champion". 

The second group goes unpunished because they don't get reported. The players' teammates might get a little annoyed if the Viktor mid never says anything all game, but that doesn't usually create a negative game experience. 

The first group gets punished because they do create a negative game experience - not because of who they play as or how they play them, but because they refuse to ever compromise on it. The issues with the Singed and Nunu players are that they _consistently_ did this, even when there were objections (Singed every time he was forced into support, Nunu every game). If this were something they only did half the time and were willing to compromise on with their teams, we would never have heard about it, because the bans would have never happened.

Basically this is a tactical disagreement which of course is not bannable. In ranked games what should matter is that each member is trying equally hard to win. What should not matter is how some ADC got annoyed because he fell behind when his support roamed (or was never there to begin with).

ef·fi·cient
əˈfiSHənt/
